channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CBS News speaks with man who says he's just been freed from Syrian prison
item.description: A man identifying himself as Missourian Travis Timmerman tells CBS News he was liberated from a Syrian prison upon dictator Bashar al-Assad's ouster.

item.title: Watch: Small plane split in two in crash on US highway
item.description: Four people, including the pilot, have been taken to hospital in Victoria, Texas.

item.title: Ethiopia and Somalia agree to end bitter Somaliland port feud
item.description: Ethiopia's deal to build a port in Somaliland had infuriated Somalia, prompting fears of wider conflict.

item.title: Children as young as 10 will face adult jail time in Australian state
item.description: Queensland's new laws will see children found guilty of serious crimes given harsher penalties.

item.title: Arguments over whether Luigi Mangione is a ‘hero’ offer a glimpse into an unusual American moment
The Geminids meteor shower peaks at the end of the week. Here's what to expect
item.description: The Geminids are one of the best and most visible annual meteor showers, when at least 120 meteors can usually be seen per hour. But 2024 will be diff...

item.title: Dear Life Kit: My daughter was left out of the holiday newsletter — again!
item.description: A father wonders why his father-in-law keeps neglecting to mention his daughter in his annual newsletter to family. It includes updates on the other g...

item.title: Biden commutes roughly 1,500 sentences and pardons 39 people in biggest single-day act of clemency
Moment of relief as Romania and Bulgaria join EU border-free zone
item.description: Seventeen years after joining the EU, the two countries are given the green light to join the Schengen zone.

item.title: Violent protests in Georgia highlight battle over the country's future
item.description: The Georgian government's move away from the European Union and closer to Russia is fueling daily protests. Here's why it matters.

item.title: Israeli boy killed in Palestinian gun attack on bus in West Bank
item.description: The bus was heading to Jerusalem from an Israeli settlement when a gunman opened fire.

item.title: These neurons in the abdomen help form the gut-brain connection
item.description: Scientists have identified two types of brain cells in the abdomen that appear to control different aspects of digestion.

item.title: Gun found on suspect in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO matches shell casings at scene, police say
item.description: New York City’s police commissioner says the gun found on the suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO matches shell casings found at the crim...

item.title: South Korea's Yoon defends martial law decree as an act of governance
item.description: In an address to the nation, President Yoon Suk Yeol claimed the opposition-controlled parliament has been destroying the country's liberal democratic...

item.title: Meta donates $1 million to Trump's inaugural fund
item.description: The move comes two weeks after Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg traveled to Florida and dined with President-elect Donald Trump in Mar-a-Lago.

item.title: Tennessee hospital was destroyed by Helene — others face risk
item.description: Flash flooding from Hurricane Helene trapped dozens of people on the rooftop of Unicoi County Hospital.

item.title: The Game Awards 2024: Key nominees and what to expect
item.description: Morning Edition host A Martinez and NPR gaming editor James Mastromarino discuss the nominees of this year's Game Awards and their significance in gam...

item.title: Biden commutes about 1,500 sentences, most ever in single day
item.description: "These actions represent the largest single-day grant of clemency in modern history," the White House said.
